details:
KESHKING SHAMPOO

DESCRIPTIONS
Kesh King Scalp and Hair Medicine Anti-Hairfall Shampoo is filled with the power of Aloe and 21 Ayurvedic Herbs and is known to reduce hair fall. This hair fall reduction shampoo is an ayurvedic proprietary medicinal preparation without any side effects. It has been made from 21 Ayurvedic Herbs as per the text prescribed in Ayurveda. It is also certified by the eminent hair institute. For Chronic hair problems, regular use of Kesh King Scalp and Hair Medicine Anti-Hairfall Shampoo along with Kesh King Ayurvedic Medicinal Oil & Capsules is advised for at least thrice a week for 3 months.
Country of origin
india

Ingredients
Neem, Aloevera Extract, Bhringaraja, Jatamansi, Musta, Brahmi, Amalaki, Nimba, Mandukparni, Methi, Manjistha, Lodhra, Mehendi, Karanja, Tulasi, Kola, Goksura, Bibhitaka, Nagkesara, Haritaki, Shikakai, Rosemary.

Features
- Hair Fall Control: The shampoo is specifically formulated to reduce hair fall and breakage, promoting stronger and healthier hair.
- Natural Ingredients:  Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo is enriched with a blend of natural ingredients like aloe vera, bhringraj, methi, and other herbs known for their hair-nourishing and strengthening properties.
- Gentle Cleansing: The shampoo effectively cleanses the scalp and hair, removing dirt, excess oil, and impurities without stripping the hair of its natural oils.
- Scalp Nourishment: Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo nourishes the scalp, helping to improve its health and create an environment conducive to hair growth.
How to Use/ Direction/step to apply
- Wet your hair thoroughly.
- Take a sufficient amount of Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo in your palm.
- Apply the shampoo to your scalp and hair, massaging gently with fingertips for a few minutes.
- Rinse thoroughly with water, ensuring that no shampoo residue remains.
- For best results, follow with a suitable conditioner or hair serum from the same brand.
- Use thrice a week for 4 weeks followed by twice a week as maintenance therapy or as directed by a physician.
Benefits
- Hair Fall Reduction: Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo helps reduce hair fall and breakage, promoting healthier and stronger hair.
- Nourishing and Strengthening: The shampoo is enriched with natural ingredients known for their hair-nourishing and strengthening properties, helping to improve the overall health of the hair.
- Cleansing and Refreshing: Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo effectively cleanses the scalp and hair, removing impurities and leaving them refreshed.
- Scalp Health: The shampoo nourishes the scalp, improving its health and creating a favourable environment for hair growth.
Storage Instructions
-  Kesh King Anti-Hairfall Shampoo should be stored in a cool and dry place, away from direct sunlight and excessive heat. 
- It is advisable to keep the bottle tightly closed to prevent any leakage or contamination.

Safety Information
-	For external use only.
-	Read the label carefully before use.
-	Do not exceed the recommended dose.
-	Keep it out of the reach of children.
-	Store it at a temperature below 25-degree Celsius and 40 % humidity in a cool and dry place.
-	Should be protected from direct light.

Risk/side effect
Common Side Effects of Kesh King Shampoo
While Kesh King Shampoo is generally safe to use, it may cause some common side effects. These side effects include dryness, itchiness, and scalp irritation. It is important to note that not everyone will experience these side effects, and they are usually mild and temporary. If you do experience any of these side effects, it is recommended to discontinue use and consult a dermatologist. It is also advisable to perform a patch test before using the shampoo to check for any allergic reactions. Additionally, using a gentle conditioner and avoiding hot water while washing your hair can help alleviate these side effects. Overall, it is essential to be aware of the potential side effects and take necessary precautions when using Kesh King Shampoo.
Rare Side Effects of Kesh King Shampoo
While rare, there are a few side effects that have been reported by some users of Kesh King Shampoo. These include scalp irritation, hair loss, and allergic reactions. It is important to note that these side effects are not experienced by everyone and may vary from person to person. If you experience any of these rare side effects, it is recommended to discontinue use of the shampoo and consult a dermatologist. It is always better to be cautious and prioritize your hair health.

Key Takeaways
-	Kesh King Shampoo may have both common and rare side effects.
-	Before using Kesh King Shampoo, it is important to take precautions and consult a dermatologist.
-	Common side effects of Kesh King Shampoo include dryness, itchiness, and hair loss.
-	Rare side effects of Kesh King Shampoo may include scalp irritation and allergic reactions.
-	Reading reviews and researching Kesh King Shampoo can help in making informed choices.

product_name: loreal paris : Laser X3 Deep Anti-Ageing Night Cream 50ml
details:
loreal paris : Laser X3 Deep Anti-Ageing Night Cream 50ml
Product details
Revitalift Laser Triple Action Anti-Ageing Night Cream, now with a NEW formula, smooths wrinkles, re-texturisers and restores the look of skin. Formulated with 3 top derm actives, Pro-Retinol, Hyaluronic Acid and Vitamin C*, this formula targets signs of ageing and renews skins appearance. Validated by dermatologists and effective on all skin types. *Vitamin Cg.

Skin feels more toned and firmer. Skin texture looks more even, and fine lines and dark spots look reduced. 

How to usse
Apply the cream every night with ascending movements on a thoroughly cleansed face and neck.
Ingredients
909306 28 - INGREDIENTS: AQUA / WATER â€¢ DIMETHICONE â€¢ SIMMONDSIA CHINENSIS SEED OIL / JOJOBA SEEDOIL â€¢ HYDROGENATED CASTOR OIL DIMER DILINOLEATE â€¢ ALCOHOL DENAT. â€¢ HYDROXYPROPYLTETRAHYDROPYRANTRIOL â€¢ GLYCERIN â€¢ ISONONYL ISONONANOATE â€¢ PROPANEDIOL â€¢ PROPYLENE GLYCOL â€¢ CETYLALCOHOL â€¢ CETYL HYDROXYETHYLCELLULOSE â€¢ CENTELLA ASIATICA EXTRACT â€¢ HYDROLYZED RICE PROTEINâ€¢ ACETYL DIPEPTIDE-1 CETYL ESTER â€¢ CAPRYLOYL SALICYLIC ACID â€¢ SODIUM CITRATE â€¢ SODIUM HYALURONATEâ€¢ SODIUM HYDROXIDE â€¢ ASCORBYL GLUCOSIDE â€¢ RETINYL PALMITATE â€¢ SILICA â€¢ BUTYLENE GLYCOL â€¢ CAPRYLYLGLYCOL â€¢ HYDRATED SILICA â€¢ HYDROXYETHYLCELLULOSE â€¢ PENTYLENE GLYCOL â€¢ POLYSORBATE 60 â€¢ SILICADIMETHYL SILYLATE â€¢ SORBITAN LAURATE â€¢ TOCOPHEROL â€¢ XANTHAN GUM â€¢ BENZYL ALCOHOL â€¢ CITRONELLOLâ€¢ ISOEUGENOL â€¢ LIMONENE â€¢ LINALOOL â€¢ PHENOXYETHANOL â€¢ PARFUM / FRAGRANCE. (F.I.L. Z70011624/1).
Country of origin
Paris

T444Z HAIR FOOD

Descriptions
Developed from plant extracts, T444Z hair food is a very effective hair product. It is a cocktail of different extracts that have been proven to deal with different hair problems. Hair loss, hair line damage, thinning hair, brittle and dry hair, itchy scalp and dry scalp are some common problems experienced. These need not bother you anymore as T444Z hair food will stop them within two months. Continued use will ensure healthy hair that grows strong and without having to use any other product.
T444Z Hair Food Ingredients
Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea butter), Aloe Barbadensis (Aloe vera callus extract), Carica papaya (papaya fruit extract), Chamomilla Recutita (matricia) oil (German chamomile), Daucus Carota Sativa (carrot oil extract), Ricinus communis (castor oil), Pelargonium Graveolens oil (geranium oil), Anthemis nobilis (Roman chamomile), Rosa damascena (rose oil), Rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary oil), Mentha Piperita (peppermint oil)
Features of T444Z hair food
â€¢	Hair growth
â€¢	hair moisturiser
â€¢	weak hair growth
â€¢	promote growth
â€¢	For dry damage hair
country of origin
United Kingdom
Directions
1. Wash your hair thoroughly to remove all the dirt and other products you may have used lately.
2. Dry your hair completely with a towel until no dampness is left, avoid using a blow dryer (it means leaving your hair for some time until it is dry).
3. Apply T444Z using your fingers to the scalp and massaging it thoroughly to ensure even distribution to the whole head. (NB.Hair grows inside the scalp so applying any cream onto the hair does not help its growth).
Useful Tips
Some styles that put tension on the hairs â€“ tight ponytails, plaits or corn-rows â€“ can cause hair loss.
Vigorous brushing is more likely to damage the hair and make the problem worse.
Only the root of the hair is alive and this gets its oxygen from the blood in the scalp. Wigs and hairpieces will damage hair only if they are too tight.
â€˜Blow-drying and heated brushes can worsen hair lossâ€™. The reason is that extreme heat damages the proteins in the hairs, making them fragile and liable to break off. Brushing the hair during blow-drying causes more damage. Careless use of heated brushes can even burn the scalp, so that the hair follicles are permanently damaged in that area.
Protein-containing conditioners only temporarily fill in defects on the surface of the hair shaft, making it smoother and thicker.
Hair dyes, perms and hairsprays do not affect thinning hair. Perms and hairsprays can help to disguise the problem.
Dos and Dontâ€™s
Massage scalp regularly to increase circulation and oil secretion
Avoid scratching scalp with finger nails or fine combs
Avoid using tight hair bands, wigs and hair retainers because they damage the hair line.
When using any product make sure you follow the instructions as advised and stick with it for the recommended period.
Avoid unnecessary dyeing or tinting and rough combing
When plaiting, make sure you avoid small and tight plaits
Risk/side effects
itching
POSSIBLE CAUSES OF ITCHING
1. Infection. Fungal or bacterial infection. Common when one has just started applying T444Z hair food. The hair food fights the infection then heals the scalp.
2. Tight style. When the scalp is pulled when plaiting/braiding it causes irritation.
3. Use of harsh shampoo
4. Improper rinsing of shampoo
5. Chemicals used to treat braids/weaves cause scalp to itch and cause rush on the scalp and face
6. Mixing t444z hair food and other products (on scalp)
7. When scalp is growing new hair. Eg in case of thin hair and balding patches. 
8. Sweat. The salt in the sweat causes irritation to the scalp.

Product name- Indomie Noodles

Indomie is a unique brand of Instant Noodles, loved by a majority of Nigerians. It has grown to become a household name in Nigeria owing to its delightful taste and wholesomeness. Transcending across all age groups, the brand has managed to win over the hearts and taste palates of both the young and the old.
Since 1988, Indomie has been a staple in Nigerian households, nourishing lives and creating lasting memories. Our journey from inception to becoming a household name is marked by our unwavering commitment to quality, taste, and value. Today, Indomie isn't just a brand—it's a part of everyday life for millions, seamlessly integrating into diverse Nigerian cultures.
Our extensive range of products enjoys unparalleled brand loyalty and holds a prestigious "top of mind" status among consumers. As we look to the future, our vision remains clear: to be the most trusted food brand, continuously leading the instant noodles category with innovation and excellence.
Product Range and Innovation
Indomie offers a diverse range of products to cater to various tastes and preferences. Some of the popular variants include:
-	Indomie Chicken Flavor: The classic favorite among many Nigerians.
-	Indomie Onion Chicken Flavor: Adds a twist with a rich onion taste.
-	Indomie Belle Full: A larger serving size to satisfy bigger appetites.
-	Indomie Super Pack: Enhanced flavor and bigger pack for more indulgence.
-	Indomie Pepper Chicken: For those who enjoy a spicy kick.
-	Indomie Oriental Fried Noodles: A unique flavor profile catering to diverse palates.
1. Ingredient Lists
Indomie Chicken Flavor:
-	Wheat Flour
-	Palm Oil
-	Iodized Salt
-	Sugar
-	Flavor Enhancers (Monosodium Glutamate, Disodium Inosinate, Disodium Guanylate)
-	Chicken Flavor Powder
-	Soy Sauce Powder
-	Onion Powder
-	Garlic Powder
-	Spices (Turmeric, Coriander, Pepper)
-	Food Additives (Sodium Polyphosphate, Sodium Carbonate)
-	Vitamins (Vitamin A, Vitamin B12, Folic Acid)
Indomie Onion Chicken Flavor:
-	Wheat Flour
-	Palm Oil
-	Iodized Salt
-	Sugar
-	Flavor Enhancers (Monosodium Glutamate, Disodium Inosinate, Disodium Guanylate)
-	Chicken Flavor Powder
-	Onion Powder
-	Garlic Powder
-	Spices (Turmeric, Coriander, Pepper)
-	Food Additives (Sodium Polyphosphate, Sodium Carbonate)
-	Vitamins (Vitamin A, Vitamin B12, Folic Acid)
Indomie Pepper Chicken:
-	Wheat Flour
-	Palm Oil
-	Iodized Salt
-	Sugar
-	Flavor Enhancers (Monosodium Glutamate, Disodium Inosinate, Disodium Guanylate)
-	Chicken Flavor Powder
-	Soy Sauce Powder
-	Onion Powder
-	Garlic Powder
-	Spices (Chili Powder, Black Pepper, Turmeric, Coriander)
-	Food Additives (Sodium Polyphosphate, Sodium Carbonate)
-	Vitamins (Vitamin A, Vitamin B12, Folic Acid)



2. Recipes Using Indomie
Classic Indomie Noodles:
1.	Boil 2 cups of water in a pot.
2.	Add the Indomie noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3.	Add the seasoning powder, oil, and chili powder (optional) from the packet.
4.	Stir well and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
5.	Serve hot.
Indomie Stir-Fry:
1.	Boil 2 packs of Indomie noodles until soft, then drain and set aside.
2.	Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a pan.
3.	Add 1 chopped onion, 1 sliced bell pepper, and 1 chopped carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
4.	Add the cooked noodles and Indomie seasoning packets.
5.	Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.
6.	Garnish with chopped spring onions and serve.
Indomie with Vegetables and Eggs:
1.	Boil 2 packs of Indomie noodles until soft, then drain and set aside.
2.	Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan.
3.	Add 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped tomato, and a handful of spinach. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
4.	Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble until cooked.
5.	Add the cooked noodles and Indomie seasoning packets.
6.	Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.
7.	Serve hot.
3. Cheap and Local Alternatives
Nigerian Made Noodles:
-	Chikki Instant Noodles: Another popular local brand offering similar flavors at a competitive price.
-	Honeywell Noodles: Known for their quality and affordability, offering various flavors like Chicken and Seafood.


Homemade Alternatives:
-	Rice Noodles: Easily available and can be prepared with local spices to mimic Indomie flavors.
-	Spaghetti with Local Spices: A budget-friendly alternative using locally available spices and ingredients.
Recipes for Homemade Noodles:
1.	Local Spice Noodles:
○	Cook spaghetti or rice noodles.
○	In a pan, heat oil and add onions, garlic, and a mix of local spices (curry powder, thyme, chili powder).
○	Add the cooked noodles and mix well.
○	Serve with a side of fried plantains or vegetables.
2.	Vegetable Noodles:
○	Cook spaghetti or rice noodles.
○	In a pan, stir-fry onions, bell peppers, carrots, and spinach.
○	Add the cooked noodles and a mix of soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
○	Serve hot.
These alternatives provide similar convenience and flavor profiles to Indomie, allowing for variety and cost savings.

Price Range
Indomie Regular Chicken Flavour 70g X 40 - ₦ 8,300
Indomie Onion Chicken 70g x 40 - ₦ 9,100

Indomie Regular Chicken Noodles 100g X 40 - ₦ 12,100

Indomie Belle Full Pack 280g x 16 - ₦ 12,900

Indomie Super Pack Chicken Flavour 120g x40 - ₦ 13,600
